programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: Venturing beyond Europe, and with local experts as his guides, Rick uses Ethiopia as a classroom for understanding global hunger and extreme poverty - and how to beat it.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: The Dordogne River Valley is a remarkable blend of man-made and natural beauty.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: Venture beyond Prague with a whirlwind of Art Nouveau and charming castles.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: Rick Steves: In Venice, we'll sample the splendor of the Doge's Palace, St. Mark's Basilica, Grand Canal, and masterpieces from the Venetian Renaissance — then take a glide on a gondola.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: At Oxford and Cambridge, we'll see where kings and prime ministers studied. Then we'll wander through Blenheim Palace and visit the Industrial Revolution at Ironbridge Gorge.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: Tuscany give us a healthy dose of the "sweet life" featuring a convertible ride.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Nothing captures the spirit of a day at the beach in Mexico than a fresh seafood cocktail or ceviche, and Rick finds a classic version in Mexico City. Then, he visits a major-league marisqueria, and shares his tips for homemade ceviche.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Tacos are Mexico's favorite mini-meal, and it turns out they are also a perfect party food. Rick and his daughter, Lanie, plan a backyard taquisa, and in the true spirit of a taquisa, Rick makes fresh corn tortillas on a hot griddle.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.sub-title: Chiles Rellenos: The Stuff of Passion
programme.desc: At the romantic San Angel Inn, Rick enjoys what might be the most passion-infused food in the Mexican canon: a quintessential plate of perfect chiles rellenos. In the Frontera kitchen, Rick provides a detailed lesson on how they are made.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Rick reveals how to plan a fiesta for 25 people that is both big and gourmet featuring Mexican takes on Spanish classics. Rick will also show you how to construct a simple outdoor brick fire-pit built for an enormous three-foot paella pan.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Join Rick on a field trip through the golden era of the haciendas, and then visit his home to make two classic Mayan-Spanish-European fusion dishes. Hacienda San Jose, a luxury resort, inspires Rick's rendition of Achiote-Seared Shrimp.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: At Hartwood restaurant, Chef Eric Werner explains the fascinating farm-to-table supply chain that provides Hartwood's live-fire kitchen with fresh ingredients. The rustic simplicity inspires Rick to shop for produce and cook up a storm.

programme.title: Rituals of the World
programme.desc: The tattooing practiced in Samoa is not comparable to the fashionable trend in Europe. In Samoa, tattooing is above all a rite signifying that the individual belongs to a group, and it is extremely painful. The more painful it is, the more Stivi approaches the state of a real, accomplished man.

programme.title: Welcome to My Strange City
programme.desc: Once at a crossroads of ancient trade routes, the ksar of Chinguetti, Mauritania exists like a pearl in the desert on the western edge of the Sahara Desert, a force of nature whose sand reaches every crook and crevice of life in this land.

programme.title: National Parks Revealed
programme.desc: Board the Empire Builder to Glacier National Park and the Denali Star to Denali National Park, experience the elegance of the American Orient Express, and the restored glory of the Grand Canyon Railway. All aboard for these and other nostalgic journeys through America's national parks.

programme.title: Inside America's National Parks
programme.desc: Experience the supreme and sacred spectacle of the Grand Canyon. This insider's view of one of the world's greatest natural wonders takes you rim-to-rim to hike hidden canyons, plunge into ancient pools, raft world-class rapids, discover manmade gems, and explore extreme backcountry.

programme.title: Lonely Planet: Best Parks Ever - America's National Parks
programme.desc: With acres of sea lions and thousands of buffalo, national parks host the largest homes to all kinds of critters. Get close to your favorite animal in this episode of Best Parks Ever.

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: Climb the ramparts of Edinburgh Castle. Tee up at the world's most famous golf course, St. Andrews. Tour Deward's whiskey distillery. Stroll Stirling's historic battlefields of Braveheart fame. And, sail the bonny banks of legendary Loch Lomond.

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: Rudy Maxa and Daisuke Utagawa take you to Japan's northern frontier Hokkaido. The hot spring capital of Japan with its many volcanoes, Hokkaido also boosts some of the world greatest ramen, ramen noodles, and legendary whiskey.

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: From the bustling city of Seoul with its 10 million residents to the country's quite countryside, South Korea is a traveler's paradise. With their misty mountain temples and the uber-modern cities, Koreans mix an abiding sense of history and traditions with a zeal to achieve global success.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.sub-title: San Sebastian: A Food Lover's Town
programme.desc: San Sebastian, Spain: Tony explores the food-crazed Basque culture. Tony's guide, Chef Luis Irizar, takes Tony into the underworld of Basque gastronomic societies. Later, Tony explores the city's tapas bars.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.sub-title: Down Under: The Wild West of Cooking
programme.desc: Melbourne, Australia boasts hard-living, good-natured, and eccentric lovers of food - Tony's kind of people. In search of the outlaws of food, Tony explores a pasteurization-free cheese factory, and an old-world cured jamon workshop.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.sub-title: Food Tastes Better with Sand Between Your Toes
programme.desc: In the Caribbean paradise of St. Martin, Tony eats a healthy Rastafarian meal with a freedom fighter, helps prepare grub for a food caravan, discovers foodstuffs not available at American supermarkets, and finally relaxes at a beach bar.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: London, England: In London, Tony attempts to dispel the myth that all English food is disgusting and over-boiled. Tony tries Nose to Tail Eating, explores traditional fare at Pie and Mash Shoppes, and then visits a predominantly Indian community.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.sub-title: Eating on the Edge of Nowhere
programme.desc: Cambodia and Japan: Taking his obsession with the film Apocalypse Now a little too seriously, Tony sets out for Pailin, reputed to be one of the most dangerous towns on earth. After his journey, Tony returns to Japan.

programme.title: WaterVoyagers - Chinese Adventures
programme.desc: See the sights and sounds in Chongqing, the Yangtze River and of course pandas.

programme.title: Discovering the World
programme.desc: Qatar is minute in surface area, but enormous in ambition. Filmed from every angle, and amid a construction boom, futuristic skyscrapers emerge from the desert, Bedouins barter their camels for powerful 4 x 4s, falconers equip their birds with electronics, and the camel jockeys are now robots.

programme.title: Rituals of the World
programme.desc: Each May, the Quechuas of the high plateau converge on Macha a spectacular and violent ritual called Tinku, a fertility ritual in the form of fighting. The blood that is shed feeds Pachamama, the Earth Mother, who is responsible for good harvests, fertility in women, and a large herd of llamas.

programme.title: Secrets of the National Parks
programme.sub-title: The Secrets of Glacier National Park
programme.desc: Experience high adventure in "the land of shining mountains." Take an unforgettable hike along the Highline Trail, raft a wild river, and travel by train aboard the renowned Empire Builder. Behold massive glaciers and get close (but not too close!) to bears. Then, relax at a high-altitude chalet.

programme.title: National Parks Revealed
programme.desc: Meet the people of America's national parks who help preserve our monuments and conserve our park's beauty. They rappel down the towering granite faces of Mount Rushmore, they execute prescribed burns in the Grand Canyon, and they plow the treacherous Going-to-the-Sun Road in Glacier National Park.

programme.title: Lonely Planet: Best Parks Ever - America's National Parks
programme.sub-title: Best Parks to Get Wet & Wild
programme.desc: From the most scenic drive in America, to the world's largest bowl of fresh water, these parks have the wettest landscape for your pleasure.

programme.title: Bare Feet with Mickela Mallozzi
programme.desc: Mickela attends Le Fete de Bayonne to celebrate French Basque Country tradition. This includes dancing the Fandango, handling giant puppets, tasting the region's traditional cuisine, and experiencing the renowned Pastorale.

programme.title: Bare Feet with Mickela Mallozzi
programme.desc: Mickela learns the Kandyan dance at the Sri Lankan Dance Academy and visits the family-owned restaurants on Victory Blvd. that prepare traditional dishes. She also celebrates with the incredibly diverse community through song and cricket.

programme.title: Epic Exploring
programme.desc: Cody travels to Pan Thiet in Vietnam.

programme.title: My Greek Table with Diane Kochilas
programme.desc: In Messinia, Diane visits with a good friend who helps her discover the secrets of this rich, giving land that is blessed with a perfect climate. The region is home to the world's first system of culinary provenance, and delicious recipes.

programme.title: My Greek Table with Diane Kochilas
programme.desc: Join Diane and explore the origins of the phyllo pie from New York City to the Greek countryside. We will also learn how to create Spanakopita, Messy Orange Pie, and how to use phyllo as a base for an array of savory and sweet dishes.

programme.title: National Parks Revealed
programme.sub-title: National Parks of the Great Southwest
programme.desc: From Canyonlands and Arches to Saguaro and Death Valley, the wonders of the American Southwest spread across extreme lands of astonishing beauty. Climb the face of a monolith millions of years in the making, seek out a sunrise horseback ride through cactus country, and much more.

programme.title: Secrets of the National Parks
programme.desc: By foot, shuttle, and horseback, gain access to the scenic and geological wonders of Zion and Bryce Canyon National Parks. In Zion, embark on an ascent of Angel's Landing. In Bryce, climb sheer cliff walls, tube down the Virgin River, and gaze upon thousands of bizarre rock spires known as hoodoos.

programme.title: Inside America's National Parks
programme.desc: Experience the supreme and sacred spectacle of the Grand Canyon. This insider's view of one of the world's greatest natural wonders takes you rim-to-rim to hike hidden canyons, plunge into ancient pools, raft world-class rapids, discover manmade gems, and explore extreme backcountry.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Anthony travels to Tokyo, where he begins in the Tsujiki market and then is introduced to techniques in preparing edomae sushi. He also learns the diets of Sumo wrestlers.
